text:
Sadia Dehlvi (1957 – 5 August 2020) was an Indian activist, writer and columnist. She worked with the daily newspaper, the "Hindustan Times", and published in "Frontline" and Urdu, Hindi and English newspapers and magazines. She criticised radical versions of Islam and called for a united understanding of Islam.
Dehlvi died on 5 August 2020 at a hospital in New Delhi from breast cancer, aged 63.
